worklogs.comment:
andygrove commented on pull request #5852: ARROW-7192: [Rust] Implement Flight server WIP
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5852
 
 
   I'm stumbling around a bit here trying to create a Flight server and could use some help.
   
   The `build.rs` successfully generates code from the Flight.proto but I'm struggling with creating an implementation because I don't know how to import/implement the associated types in the `FlightService` trait. The generated code has:
   
   ```rust
       pub trait FlightService: Send + Sync + 'static {
           #[doc = "Server streaming response type for the Handshake method."]
           type HandshakeStream: Stream<Item = Result<super::HandshakeResponse, tonic::Status>>
               + Send
               + Sync
               + 'static;
   ```
   
   I'm trying to create an impl like this:
   
   ```rust
   impl FlightService for FlightServiceImpl {
   
       async fn handshake(
           &self,
           request: tonic::Request<tonic::Streaming<HandshakeRequest>>,
       ) -> Result<tonic::Response<arrow_flight::server::FlightService::HandshakeStream>, tonic::Status> {
           unimplemented!()
       }
   ```
   
   I get this error:
   
   ```
   27 |     ) -> Result<tonic::Response<arrow_flight::server::FlightService::HandshakeStream>, tonic::Status> {
      |                                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use fully-qualified syntax: `<Type as server::arrow_flight::server::FlightService>::HandshakeStream`
   ```
   
   Does anyone know how to resolve this?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

andygrove commented on issue #5852: ARROW-7192: [Rust] Implement Flight server WIP
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5852#issuecomment-554774325
 
 
   Made some progress. Now the main method fails to compile with:
   
   ```
   31  |       let svc: FlightService = FlightServiceServer::new(service);
       |                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
       |                |
       |                associated type `HandshakeStream` must be specified
       |                associated type `ListFlightsStream` must be specified
       |                associated type `DoGetStream` must be specified
       |                associated type `DoPutStream` must be specified
       |                associated type `DoActionStream` must be specified
       |                associated type `ListActionsStream` must be specified
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nevi-me commented on issue #5852: ARROW-7192: [Rust] Implement Flight server WIP
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5852#issuecomment-554864664
 
 
   > Made some progress. Now the main method fails to compile with:
   > 
   > ```
   > 31  |       let svc: FlightService = FlightServiceServer::new(service);
   >     |                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   >     |                |
   >     |                associated type `HandshakeStream` must be specified
   >     |                associated type `ListFlightsStream` must be specified
   >     |                associated type `DoGetStream` must be specified
   >     |                associated type `DoPutStream` must be specified
   >     |                associated type `DoActionStream` must be specified
   >     |                associated type `ListActionsStream` must be specified
   > ```
   
   Hi Andy, I fixed the code and pushed to your branch. 
   
   You shouldn't specify the `FlightService` type there because `FlightServiceServer::new(service)` returns `FlightServiceServer<FlightServiceImpl>`.
   
   The main cause of the compilation error was however the import of the compiled protos. I don't know why, but it's a bit frustrating at first that `prost` doesn't consider the same proto import as equal when imported in 2 projects (in this case the bin and lib).
   
   If there isn't a solution to this, it might end up causing frustration to users (unless they don't need to compile their own protobufs).
   What I normally do is convert `crate_a::proto::MyMessage` to `bytes::BytesMut` then encode `crate_b::proto::MyMessage` from the bytes. I'm probably doing something wrong; ping @LucioFranco
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

LucioFranco commented on issue #5852: ARROW-7192: [Rust] Implement Flight server WIP
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5852#issuecomment-554942368
 
 
   @nevi-me I'm not directly following the problem? Prost/Tonic just generate rust code. Under the hood `include_proto` just use `include!` which will bring the rust code as if it were defined directly in that module. So just like any other rust code if you define something in one crate it belongs to that crate.
   
   Usually, what you probably want to do is to have an intermediary crate that is just the compiled protos so that libs/bins can just reference that one. Let me know if that makes sense! Happy to help more! (I am currently on the train in the middle of france so I might be slow to respond)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   I have split this into two crates now. One for the generated code and one for the demo.
   
   I guess I'll quickly run into a dependency on IPC now and can start helping with that.

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

fields.description: Implement a flight crate that can run a gRPC server that understands the flight protocol. This will be a library and the user will need to provide implementations of one or more traits to plug in their logic.
